ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and the night when it withdraws
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And the night when on the wane,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and by the night when it recedes,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And by oath of the night when it turns back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And by the night when it withdraws.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the night when it departs,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and the night when it retreats
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And the night when it withdraweth
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: By the night when it departs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By the night when it with draweth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: By the night when it recedes!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And by the Night as it retreateth,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And by the night when it withdraws,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And the night as it retreats.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [by] the night when it departs
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [74:33] And by the night when it returns! (if read as idhā dabara), when it comes back after day (a variant reading has idh adbara, meaning ‘when it has receded’).
